result.execSummary:
The defendant Drew S Sweeney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.
Concurrent with: with all other counts

superMiscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary

Not have have contact with anyone under the age of 18 years of age, Except his son, unless approved by agent and an approve dchaperone is present

Enter into, participate in and successfully complete all assessments, evaluations and treatement programs directed by the agent

Not to posses any internet browser device, cell phone, compouter, video garm system without prior agent approval

To pay all court ordered obligations and supervision fees as directed by agent.

Submission of DNA sample either while in confinement or on the day of the placement on probation or Exteded Supervision

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: with all other counts

records.addlTxt: 2:19 p.m.  Defendant Drew S Sweeney in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lennon makes a statement on record to a correction to the PSI.  Atty. Grode argues for his recommended sentence.  Atty. Lennon argues for his recommendation.   Mr. Vantry makes a statement to the Court in support of the defendant.  Court addresses Mr. Vantry's statements.  Drew makes a statement to the Court.  Court makes sentence.  Atty. Lennon requests the computer be returned for family photo.  Court instructs Atty. Lennon to work with the DA's office.
from Atty Lennon notifying of rescheduled sentencing date.
from Atty Lennon requesting an adjournment of the sentencing hearing.

11:47 Defendant Drew S Sweeney in court with attorney William M Lennon.  Craig S Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon enters plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease/Defect.  Atty Lennon to prepare the Order for Competency Evaluation.  Court sets for PTC and continues the bond.

11:47 Defendant Drew S Sweeney in court with attorney William M Lennon.  Craig S Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lennon waives prelim hearing on behalf of his client.  Court questions Sweeney and accepts the waiver.  Court binds the matter over for Arraignment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
